caption.p: Map of the study area. Source regions are shown as coloured basins; the divide separating the eastern and western slopes along the Tien Shan – Pamir – Karakoram is shown as a red line, the international frontiers as grey double dashed lines; and the precipitation patterns as inset column graphs. The eastern slope basins (with initial letter E) are: EJG, Jungar rivers; EKD, Kaidu River; EWG, Weigan River; ETL, Tailan River; ETR, Tarim River; EKG, Kashgar River; the western slope basins (with initial letter W) are: WIL, Ili River; WCH, Chu River; WSY, Syr Darya River; and WAM, Amu Darya River.
